Welcome to Data-Explorer’s Documentation!

Data-Explorer is an open-source Python library designed to streamline your workflow in: - Analyzing datasets and extracting key insights, - Generating thorough reports on both numeric and categorical features, - Performing pre-analysis tasks like outlier detection and data distribution visualization, - Conducting text analysis, such as word frequency and word clouds.

Whether you’re looking to quickly assess data quality, explore feature importance, or visualize text data, Data-Explorer provides concise functions that integrate seamlessly into your Python data pipelines.

Below, you’ll find an overview of each module: - Analysis

Tools for feature correlation, feature importance, and related exploratory analyses.

  • Data Report Quick generation of initial data reports, numeric/categorical column summaries, and other diagnostic insights.

  • Pre-Analysis Utilities for plotting distributions, detecting outliers, generating correlation heatmaps, and more.

  • Text Analysis Functions for building word clouds, frequency charts, and other natural language data visualizations.
